text: Dominic Felix Amici (May 31, 1908 - December 6, 1993) was an American movie, television, stage, voice, radio actor, and comedian. He was known for his roles as Mortimer Duke in Trading Places and in Coming to America and as Art Selwyn in Cocoon and in Cocoon: The Revenge. He has won an Academy Award and a Volpi Cup. Ameche was born on May 31, 1908 in Kenosha, Wisconsin; his father was an Italian immigrant and his mother had an Irish-German ancestry. He studied at Marquette University, at Loras College and the University of Wisconsin. Ameche was married to Honore Prendergast from 1932 until her death in 1986. He had four sons and two daughters. Ameche died on December 6, 1993 in his son's house in Scottsdale, Arizona from prostate cancer, aged 85. ==References== ==Other websites== * * * * * Category:1908 births Category:1993 deaths Category:American Academy Award winning actors Category:American movie actors Category:American radio actors Category:American stage actors Category:American television actors Category:American voice actors Category:Cancer deaths in Arizona Category:Deaths from prostate cancer Category:Actors from Kenosha, Wisconsin
title: Don Ameche
